msg

Class MessagingService

  • java.lang.Object
    • msg.MessagingService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class MessagingService
extends Object
implements Runnable
    Handles any Message sent between classes within TRDR.

    All methods are static for global availability and use.

    Locks are required when accessing the callback functions for each key.

    Author:
    Kyle
    See Also:
    Message

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessagingService()
      Creates a MessagingService to handle all Message communication

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessagingService

        public MessagingService()
        Creates a MessagingService to handle all Message communication

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the MessagingService.

      • send

        public static void send(Message msg)
        Adds Message to queue for transmission to destination.
        Parameters:
        msg - a Message with a destination and contents
        See Also:
        Message

      • register

        public static void register(String dest,
            CallBack func)
        Registers a CallBack function with MessagingService.

        WARNING: registering the same CallBack with the MessagingService under different aliases may cause issues with out-of-order Message execution.

        Parameters:
        dest - the name by which this CallBack function will be referenced by any Message
        func - the CallBack function any relevant Message will be submitted to
        See Also:
        CallBack, Message

      • retire

        public static void retire(String dest,
          CallBack func)
        Retires a CallBack function from MessagingService.

        Parameters:
        dest - the original name with which the CallBack function was registered
        func - the CallBack function to be retired
        See Also:
        CallBack, Message

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
